subject: Programming
title: Why Fundamentals Never Expire
description: A short lesson to help you apply Why Fundamentals Never Expire.

hook.text: Frameworks come and go every year. Arrays, trees, and hash tables have been here for decades.

buildup.text: Every database, search engine, and operating system is built on the same fundamental structures.

discovery.text: Learning data structures teaches you how to think about performance, not just how to use a library.

twist.text: AI tools can generate code, but understanding why one structure beats another requires human judgment.

climax.text: The developers who understand fundamentals adapt to any language, framework, or paradigm.

quiz.question: Why are data structure fundamentals still important?
options: They teach performance thinking that transcends tools
They are required for job applications only
They are only useful for academic research
